revised_title: The Presence and Significance of Sulphocyanides in Saliva and Urine
tldr: The author investigates the presence of sulphocyanides in saliva and urine, finding that a red color reaction with perchloride of iron is common in saliva, and that sulphocyanides are also present in urine. The presence of sulphocyanides in saliva and urine may serve as indicators of overall health.
